docs.snippet: Twitter Inc will start banning cryptocurrency advertising from Tuesday, joining Facebook and Google in a clampdown that seeks to avoid giving publicity to potential fraud or large investor losses.

headline.print_headline: Twitter to Ban Cryptocurrency Ads From Tuesday as Online Crackdown Widens
headline.main: Twitter to Ban Cryptocurrency Ads From Tuesday as Online Crackdown Widens

docs.snippet: British Prime minister Theresa May on Wednesday backed an investigation into Cambridge Analytica, the consultancy at the heart of a storm over the use of Facebook data.

headline.print_headline: British PM May Backs Cambridge Analytica Investigation
headline.main: British PM May Backs Cambridge Analytica Investigation

docs.snippet: A deep sell-off across technology companies on Monday on U.S. stock markets left some investors worrying how much longer those high-flying stocks' market leadership would last.

docs.snippet: British Prime Minister Theresa May sent a letter of condolence to Russian President Vladimir Putin over the death of at least 64 people in a fire at a Siberian shopping mall, the British embassy in Moscow said on its Facebook page on Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: May Sends Putin Letter of Condolence Over Deadly Mall Fire
